file_content.text: Come in, Lieutenant. This is General Garza. I understand you've just set down on Alderaan.
The political situation on Alderaan is highly complicated. The world's ruling families are mired in a civil war for control of the planet.
House Organa supports the Republic, so they're our primary ally. Your mission against the Havoc traitors is priority one, but try to aid the Organas where you can as well.
Understood, General.
Who will I be aiding House Organa against?
And the opposition?
So what, we're mercenaries now?
You're kidding me.
No, Lieutenant, we are not. An Organa victory is in the best interest of the Republic, which has always been our primary concern.
The Empire supports House Organa's rival, House Thul. Thul was banished from Alderaan, but with the Empire's support, they've returned to make an attempt for control of the planet.
How much support is Thul actually getting from the Empire?
The Empire's full might?
Quite a bit. Intelligence reports indicate that Imperial troops operate openly on Thul's behalf all over Alderaan.
Does this sort of thing happen a lot on Alderaan?
Are these conflicts common?
Not at all. The succession of Alderaan's throne has been decided peacefully for centuries.
Anything else I should know?
House Thul bad--got it.
Organa and Thul are not the only ones seeking control of Alderaan--several other houses are also involved. The most powerful is House Ulgo, along with their ally, House Rist.
Now, your primary mission. Your target is Gearbox. A captured Thul nobleman has revealed his presence to our House Organa allies.
Apparently, Gearbox is aiding House Thul and the Empire in their effort to take control of Alderaan, though we don't yet know the full nature of that assistance.
I'll ascertain Gearbox's objective immediately, General.
Understood.
If it's something of interest, certainly recover what records you can. But your main objective remains the man himself.
Whatever Gearbox is up to, I'll put a stop to it.
Leave everything to me.
That's all the intel you have for me?
Is that it?
Be grateful that we have anything at all, Lieutenant.
You should speak to the Thul nobleman that House Organa captured and see if you can get more information from him.
The Thul prisoner is being held in isolation at House Organa's estate. I left strict instructions that no one interact with him further until you arrive.
I'll proceed to the Organa estate at once, General.
Then it's time to move out.
Are there any limitations on questioning the prisoner?
How far can I push this guy?
I'll leave that to your discretion, Lieutenant. But this man is currently our only link to Gearbox--we wouldn't want to waste that.
I do love a good interrogation.
This should be fun.
This is a means to an end, Lieutenant--get the intel you need, and then move out.
The overseer at Organa's detention center is a man named Balic Cormac, a captain in their house military. He will be your primary contact.
That's it, Lieutenant. Question the prisoner, determine Gearbox's whereabouts and neutralize him. Understood?
I'll be done in no time.
Understood, General.
Who am I taking out? Gearbox or the prisoner?
Wait, neutralize which one?
Gearbox, primarily. Both, if necessary.
Am I going to do this, or are we going to talk all day?
Can I go now?
No, I think I've spent enough time speaking with you for the time being.
Good luck, Lieutenant. Garza out.
